item.author: Unknown
item.description: I recently realized stdout is much faster than stderr for Rust. Here are my findings after diving deep into this rabbit hole.

item.title: Generating terminal user interfaces with Ratatui + ChatGPT
item.author: Unknown
item.description: "Ratatui" is a Rust library for building rich terminal user interfaces. In this post, I'm sharing what's new in the latest version and also a fun way to easily create terminal user interfaces in a jiffy.

item.title: Zig Bits 0x4: Building an HTTP client/server from scratch
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Let's experiment with the std.http module of Zig >=0.11 and create an HTTP server/client from scratch (along with some benchmarks)!

item.author: Unknown
item.description: "Ratatui" came a long way since its transition from the original tui-rs crate. In this post, let's take a look at what's new in the latest version.

item.title: Taking Rust to the Cloud: Blazingly Fast File Sharing
item.author: Unknown
item.description: "rustypaste" is a self-hosted and minimal file upload/pastebin service written in Rust. In this post, I will be talking about its features and telling the story behind how I deployed it to shuttle.rs to make it publicly available for free use.

item.title: Zig Bits 0x3: Mastering project management in Zig
item.author: Unknown
item.description: In this post, I'm sharing tips & tricks about managing/maintaining an open-source Zig project and mentioning the commonly used practices. I'm also giving a brief introduction to my first-ever Zig project "linuxwave" which led to the writing of this series.

item.title: Setting up a packaging environment for Alpine Linux (introducing alpkg)
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Recently I have been interested in Alpine Linux and thought it would be nice to maintain some Rust packages in their repositories. In this post, I will share my notes/adventures on setting up a packaging environment and a tool called "alpkg" for automating this process.

item.title: Zig Bits 0x2: Using defer to defeat memory leaks
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Let's talk about how to detect memory leaks in Zig and avoid them by using the defer statement.

item.title: Introducing runst: Handle desktop notifications neatly on Linux!
item.author: Unknown
item.description: runst is a dead simple notification daemon ü¶° In this post, I'm introducing the project and giving different usage examples that will improve your Linux desktop experience.

item.title: Zig Bits 0x1: Returning slices from functions
item.author: Unknown
item.description: I decided to start a new blog series called "Zig Bits" where I share interesting bits of information about the Zig programming language. This series will be especially for beginners because I'm also a beginner.

item.title: Packaging Rust Applications for the NPM Registry
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Recently I packaged my project git-cliff (changelog generator written in Rust) for NPM with the help of my friend @atlj. I thought this would be an interesting topic for a blog post since it has a certain technical depth about distributing binaries and frankly it still amazes me how the whole thing works so smoothly. So let's create a simple Rust project, package it for NPM and fully automate the release process via GitHub Actions.

item.title: Zero-dependency random number generation in Rust
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Let's investigate how to generate random numbers without external dependencies in Rust.

item.title: Open Source Grindset Explained

item.description: Let's talk about how to develop an open sourcerer mindset.

item.title: I finally found out why I'm so depressed
item.author: Unknown
item.description: I'm in Norway and depressed.

item.title: My motivation towards working on open source
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Some thoughts about open source and the software industry.

item.title: Move away from streaming platforms & take your music offline
item.author: Unknown
item.description: I don't use Spotify or any other streaming platform for listening to music. Some call it old habits, some call it needless effort, but I'm very used to downloading MP3 files over the internet and putting them in a folder on my phone then using the whatever default media player I have installed. However, for a couple of years, I have been following a better and automated approach for taking my music offline and feeling a bit less like I'm in a consumerism bubble.

item.title: How hard upgrading a Rust JWT library could be?
item.author: Unknown
item.description: Recently one of my clients requested me to maintain their Rust project. It is a web server that is built with Rocket + Diesel and running stable for a couple of years now. Like any other Rust developer would do, the first thing that I checked was the outdated dependencies via cargo-outdated. The result was close to what I expected: most of the dependencies were out-of-date. However, among all those crates, rust-jwt caught my eye. It was 12 minor versions behind!

item.title: Rewriting sysctl(8) in Rust: systeroid
item.author: Unknown
item.description: sysctl is a simple and great tool for modifying the kernel parameters. It does its job very well by providing an easy-to-use interface for /proc/sys. It is maintained as a part of procps toolkit for years and it can easily be considered a legacy tool today. So why not push it to its limits and turn it into a more user-friendly and even more useful tool with the power of Rust?

item.title: git-cliff 0.5.0
item.author: Unknown
item.description: git-cliff is a highly customizable changelog generator that follows conventional commit specifications ‚õ∞Ô∏è In this post, I'm explaining the new features in the 0.5.0 release while giving insight into the different use-cases.

item.author: Unknown
item.description: gpg-tui is a TUI for managing the GnuPG keys üîê In this post, I'm giving a brief introduction to the project as well as describing the thought process and main development challenges behind it.

item.description: A guide for spinning up your own instance of 0x0, a no-bullshit file hosting and URL shortening service.
